channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 29
item.description:
May 29, 2020 7:45 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Friday, May 29.

item.title: Coronavirus: New criteria for discharge will free up testing capacity
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

The decision to discharge clinically healthy Covid-19 patients without the need for further tests will free up testing capacity, said Associate Professor Kenneth Mak.

item.title: Wealthy Singaporeans still buying luxury homes amid downturn
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

With Covid-19 putting paid to any travel plans in the near future, Mr David Yong plans to sample the resort life at Sentosa Cove instead.

item.title: Eight Singaporeans nabbed in Singapore, Malaysia drug bust
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Eight Singaporeans have been arrested for suspected drug offences following a collaborative drug bust between the Malaysian and Singaporean authorities.

item.title: Coronavirus: Testing, contact tracing measures for business travellers as curbs are eased
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

New measures and procedures such as compulsory testing will be put in place as Singapore looks to progressively ease restrictions on essential business travel. The plan is to establish "green lanes" and "travel bubbles" with countries where Covid-19 is under control, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: Argentina withdraws recognition of Singapore's honorary consul amid probe
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's honorary consul-general in Buenos Aires has been stripped of his position in Argentina following an investigation into allegations of fraud and embezzlement of public funds.

item.title: Coronavirus: 13 pre-school staff have tested positive but at least 11 are old infections
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Thirteen pre-school staff have tested positive for Covid-19 since active screening for that group began this month, said the Health Ministry yesterday.

item.title: Spoof Facebook page: Man fired by HDB now assisting police in probe
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

A man fired by the Housing Board for his involvement in a spoof Facebook page is assisting the police with investigations.

item.title: Coronavirus: Job security of migrant workers depends on employers
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

The job security of migrant workers who return to work after quarantine will depend on their employers and the state of the economy, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Orthopaedic surgeon gets eight-month suspension for not giving driver sufficient leave after accident
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

An orthopaedic surgeon has been suspended for eight months for not giving a patient sufficient medical leave following an accident.

item.title: Growing concern over link between coronavirus and blood clots
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Asymptomatic Covid-19 patients could be unaware they are at risk, said anÂ expert.

item.title: MyRepublic customers in northern, western Singapore hit by Internet outage
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Broadband customers of Internet service provider MyRepublic in the north and west of Singapore faced issues with connecting to the Web yesterday morning.

item.title: Task force fleshes out plans for next steps in reopening Singapore economy
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Even as Singapore prepares for the lifting of the circuit breaker measures on Tuesday, a ministerial task force yesterday fleshed out plans for how the country might move on to phase two of opening up the economy by the end of next month.

item.title: Coronavirus: No Singaporeans, PRs among new cases, first time since Feb 23
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 1,018 Covid-19 patients were discharged yesterday, after the Ministry of Health announced earlier in the day a change in its discharge criteria for patients.

item.title: Coronavirus: Scheme pays out $360m to self-employed
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

A scheme to support the self-employed amid the virus outbreak has paid out around $360 million.

item.title: Man accused of cheating firm in Covid-19-related scam
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

A man suspected of defrauding an overseas distribution firm of more than US$646,000 (S$917,000) was charged yesterday with one count of cheating, in one of the biggest scams related to the Covid-19 outbreak here.

item.title: Coronavirus: Strict safety measures in place for staff and shoppers, say supermarts
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Supermarkets and wet markets have emerged as potential hot spots in the spread of the coronavirus, as several people who tested positive for the virus over the past week had visited these places for 30 minutes or more, according to the authorities.

item.title: Executors of woman's will liable to pay son $87k
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

A district judge has held that two women, who became co-executrices of a dying woman's will in 2003 to fulfil her wishes, are liable to pay about $87,000 from the estate to her now-adult son. One of the duo was also the guardian of the son after his mother died in 2003, a first such reported case of a guardian-cum-executor being taken to court by the ward, now aged 29.

item.title: Covid-19 patients can be discharged after 21 days if well
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Coronavirus patients who are clinically well by the 21st day of their illness will be discharged, as more scientific evidence shows they are no longer infectious.

item.title: What you can do to protect yourself at shops
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Wear a mask correctly by ensuring that it is not loose and that your nose is not exposed

item.title: Singapore PR charged over illegal carpooling service
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

A man appeared in a district court yesterday for allegedly providing unlawful carpooling services amid the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: Almost entire economy to reopen under phase two
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Phase two of Singapore's exit from the circuit breaker will entail the resumption of a wider range of activities and the reopening of almost the entire economy, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong yesterday.

item.title: Activist's article in US magazine on dorms gives distorted view: Singapore ambassador
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

An article in the American publication Foreign Policy (FP) on Covid-19 cases in migrant worker dormitories presents a "distorted view of Singapore's response" to the outbreak, said the Republic's Ambassador to the United States.

item.title: Russian accused of molestation, other offences
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

A Russian man accused of molesting a woman and threatening to kill a police officer has been charged with offences related to the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore, KL in talks to ease border curbs, but with safeguards in place
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and Malaysia are in talks to ease travel restrictions, with the necessary protocols and measures in place, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: More complaints about cigarette smoke and noise from neighbours during Covid-19 circuit breaker
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

One reader said her family has been disturbed by their neighbour who has been hammering and knocking in her unit every day.

item.title: Access to online trading platform Arotrade blocked
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

An overseas online trading platform linked to fraudulent marketing tactics has been blocked in Singapore.

item.title: Coronavirus: Dining in, meeting friends allowed in phase two, but capped at groups of 5
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

When phase two of the post-circuit breaker measures kicks in, people will once again be allowed to dine in at food and beverage outlets, meet friends and visit family members.

item.title: Catholic, Methodist churches will not reopen for private worship on June 2
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Catholic and Methodist churches will not reopen for private worship when Singapore exits its circuit breaker period next Tuesday.

item.title: Free access to eight SPH e-newspapers extended for NLB users
item.description:
May 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Readers who have been enjoying free access to the electronic newspapers through the National Library Board (NLB) can continue to do so past the circuit breaker period. The free access for library patrons to eight digital editions of Singapore Press Holdings (SPH) newspapers will be extended until further notice.

item.title: 1,018 Covid-19 patients discharged in Singapore; 2 new clusters in dormitories
item.description:
May 29, 2020 12:10 AM

SINGAPORE - A total of 1,018 Covid-19 patients were discharged on Thursday (May 28), after the Ministry of Health (MOH) announced that all coronavirus patients who are assessed to be clinically well and no longer infectious by day 21 of their illness will be discharged without having to undergo further tests.

item.title: Facebook page run by Alex Tan barred from receiving financial benefit under Pofma
item.description:
May 29, 2020 12:07 AM

SINGAPORE - The National Times Singapore Facebook page has been barred from receiving any financial benefit after it published a post with multiple false statements, at least three of which were the subject of a correction direction under Singapore's laws against fake news.
